markdown: HomeCIS AdvisoriesUPDATED – MS-ISAC CYBERSECURITY ADVISORY - Multiple Vulnerabilities in Apple Products Could Allow for Arbitrary Code Execution PATCH: NOW - TLP: CLEARUPDATED – MS-ISAC CYBERSECURITY ADVISORY - Multiple Vulnerabilities in Apple Products Could Allow for Arbitrary Code Execution PATCH: NOW - TLP: CLEARMS-ISAC ADVISORY NUMBER:2023-100DATE(S) ISSUED:09/12/2023OVERVIEW:Additional systems were found to be affected by vulnerabilities, the most severe of which could allow for arbitrary code execution.SYSTEMS AFFECTED:macOS Big Sur prior to 11.7.10 macOS Monterey prior to 12.6.9 iOS prior to 15.7.9 iPadOS prior to 15.7.9RISK:Government:Large and medium government entitiesN/ASmall governmentN/ABusinesses:Large and medium business entitiesN/ASmall business entitiesN/AHome Users:N/AREFERENCES:Applehttps://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213913https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213914https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213915Get Email Updates When Cyber Threats Like This Arise Subscribe to Advisories Information HubAdvisories See All Advisories Advisory09.03.20242024-094: Multiple Vulnerabilities in Google Chrome Could Allow for Arbitrary Code ExecutionRead MoreWhite Paper08.29.2024The CIS Security Operations Center (SOC): The Key to Growing Your SLTT's Cyber MaturityRead MoreAdvisory08.24.20242024-093: Multiple Vulnerabilities in SolarWinds Web Help Desk Could Allow for Remote Code ExecutionRead MoreBlog Post08.14.2024The Chinese Communist Party (CCP): A Quest for Data ControlRead More
